Constructor Detail

Vertices

public Vertices(int $maxElements)
Used by Object3d to hold the lists of vertex points, texture coordinates (UV), normals, and vertex colors. Use "addVertex()" to build the vertex data for the Object3d instance associated with this instance. Direct manipulation of position, UV, normal, or color data can be done directly through the associated 'buffer list' instances contained herein.

Vertices

public Vertices(int $maxElements,
                java.lang.Boolean $useUvs,
                java.lang.Boolean $useNormals,
                java.lang.Boolean $useColors)
This version of the constructor adds 3 boolean arguments determine whether uv, normal, and color lists will be used by this instance. Set to false when appropriate to save memory, increase performance.

Vertices

public Vertices(Number3dBufferList $points,
                UvBufferList $uvs,
                Number3dBufferList $normals,
                Color4BufferList $colors)

addVertex

public short addVertex(float $pointX,
                       float $pointY,
                       float $pointZ,
                       float $textureU,
                       float $textureV,
                       float $normalX,
                       float $normalY,
                       float $normalZ,
                       short $colorR,
                       short $colorG,
                       short $colorB,
                       short $colorA)
Use this to populate an Object3d's vertex data. Return's newly added vertex's index If hasUvs, hasNormals, or hasColors was set to false, their corresponding arguments are just ignored.

addVertex

public short addVertex(Number3d $point,
                       Uv $textureUv,
                       Number3d $normal,
                       Color4 $color)
More structured-looking way of adding a vertex (but potentially wasteful). The VO's taken in as arguments are only used to read the values they hold (no references are kept to them). Return's newly added vertex's index If hasUvs, hasNormals, or hasColors was set to false, their corresponding arguments are just ignored.
